item.title: Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and execution of fraud detection strategies using advanced analytical methodologies and techniques. These fraud detection strategies will be applied with the goal of reducing RBC’s Fraud Risk and losses, while maintaining a positive client experience and controlling operating costs. You will innovate and implement novel methodologies to improve detection and efficiency across the team, further automating and streamlining processes.  You will contribute to and support a variety of projects and initiatives across Fraud Management and collaborate with multiple stakeholders at varying levels of seniority.

Please Note: This position is not a people manager role and we welcome applicants from across Canada to work in a hybrid capacity.

What will you do?

  • Implement advanced analytical methodologies and proactively identify opportunities to innovate new techniques for fraud detection strategy creation and process and technology improvements
  • Collaborate with Data Science & Innovation on machine learning and artificial intelligence projects that impact fraud detection, document methodology and standardize process to ensure repeatability
  • Develop, maintain and optimize fraud detection strategies for non-traditional channels & products, and explore multiple data sources to proactively identify emerging fraud trends and patterns
  • Leverage reporting to monitor the performance of existing fraud detection strategies, optimize these strategies and use analytical tools to improve detection strategies, enhancing the tools & techniques
  • Prioritize fraud detection alerts across detection platforms, verify that all rule deployments are accurate and ensure a balance between fraud losses, client experience and operational costs
  • Contribute to Fraud Management projects and initiatives, provide detection recommendations and  implement detection strategies by project deadlines
  • Develop Fraud Detection analytics best practices, contribute to the development and implementation of the rule strategy framework and create programming code standards for fraud detection
  • Collaborate across the team to ensure best practices are applied, act as a technical resource for other team members and respond to inquiries regarding fraud data and detection strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ years’ experience in analytics or data science related roles, working with large, real-world datasets
  • Strong practical knowledge of, and proven experience with, analytical software packages and various programming languages (eg: SAS, R, SQL, Python etc.)
  • Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with the ability to solve complex problems and develop data-driven solutions
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate analytical recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Thought leadership capability to lead complex initiatives and discussions driven by analytical and business insights
  • Ability to see the big picture and guide groups with strategic thinking
  • Excellent time management skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize workload effectively
  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Scala or other big-data platform technology/tools
  • Knowledge of Canadian banking and payment industry payments transaction data and financial fraud 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Continued career advancement opportunities
  • Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-AB-CALGARY, CAN-BC-VANCOUVER, CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Full time

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Associate - Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate - Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics you will work closely with business and technology teams across Wealth Management Europe (WME) to support the ongoing maintenance of the Data Analytics infrastructure and with the delivery of analytical insights to business.

UKJERSEYWM

What will you do?

  • Support the design, development and ongoing maintenance of the scalable Data Analytics data infrastructure using the Microsoft SQL technology stack to serve as the foundational layer for analytics and insights, support and guide team on technical design and implementations
  • Identify, source, stage and model data using industry standard technologies and established development and operational practices as part of the end-to-end data lifecycle
  • Work with the business and senior team members to identify and source data points across core platforms and processes for inclusion within the Data Analytics data repository
  • Ability to structure large disparate data sets to serve multiple functions and tailor the results for specific audiences, supporting the creation of model development to support investigation and analysis
  • Ability to create new and modify existing T-SQL scripts, stored procedures and SSIS packages to support new and regular reporting requirements
  • Research, explore and understand business problems and reporting requirements and support in the design, development and deployment of solutions and dashboards, enabling end-user self-service, incorporating drill-down functionality
  • Provide data driven and thought provoking insights to drive informed decision-making, supporting the transfer of knowledge to stakeholders to use its data more effectively
  • Adhere to the established DevOps’s process to ensure that new or changes to existing source code or DB structure follow the agreed development and release processes and that all productionised code is adequately documented and reviewed

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience with MS SQL Server, Data Warehousing techniques, solutions and methodologies
  • Good understanding of relational database principals
  • Good knowledge of SQL, working with ETL\'s and SSIS packages
  • Data management analyst with ability to mine and visualize data
  • Good understanding of datasets, data warehouses /modelling, database design and programming

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Tableau
  • Experience with JIRA
  • Experience with GitHub
  • Knowledge of Agile project management principles

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible and hybrid working options fully supported

item.title: Manager, Program Governance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Program Governance

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Program Governance, you will support the delivery of analytical insights for Global Finance IT and build interactive and intuitive dashboards to model data. This role will also be responsible for the oversight of project management tools to ensure appropriate IT cost recovery to various lines of businesses. You will report on various key performance indicators to Senior Management related to financial health and resource capacity trends. In addition, you will work intimately with project managers to leverage best practices on project expenditure management.

What will you do?

  • Provide administration for Finance IT’s project management tools (Planview/MIS) for Finance IT’s development and maintenance portfolio of $100mm+, including the creation/upkeep/closure of projects, population of key data attributes, and ensuring proper cost recovery of all IT personnel
  • Support project managers and delivery leads in administering project management tools and managing all aspects of financials (monitoring of actuals vs plan, forecasting, processing of invoices)
  • Reconcile contractor cost recoveries in Planview/MIS to professional fee accrual during month-end at the contract and resource level
  • Support executive and portfolio level financial/KPI reporting
  • Automate existing reporting and enhance data visualization/analytics through various productivity tools (Tableau, VBA, etc); develop new automated solutions to improve productivity and efficiency
  • Maintain a healthy, accurate financial control environment within the Finance IT Business Management Office, reinforcing our role as the source of financial truth (App Dev, Maintenance, 3rd Party, NIE, etc)
  • Monitoring and communicating key performance metrics and operational challenges
  • Implement change management as required for new implementations and enhancements for project management tools

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Bachelor’s degree, with a focus in finance, accounting, computer science, business or mathematics.
  • Experience in a financial control environment
  • Data analytics and reporting experience on large data sets and multiple sources
  • Advanced command of Microsoft Excel, Word, Powerpoint, and data visualization tools
  • Basic financial services and accounting knowledge

Nice-to-have

Notes:

  • Previous experience with Tableau, SQL, Planview
  • Experience in an IT delivery team with a focus on project management, and the systems development lifecycle
  • CPA, PMP, MBA designation(s)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities          
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
  • #LI-HYBRID
  • #LI-POST

item.title: Corporate Actions Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Corporate Actions Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Client Data Management team (CDM) is responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the static reference data for Capital Markets clients, counterparties, and other entities of interest. This data includes names, addresses, identifiers, classifications, hierarchies, and other attributes that are required for business and operational processes, regulatory monitoring and reporting, revenue reporting and client analytics, and Risk and Finance purposes.  CDM maintains this information in the Client Data Repository (CDR) system, which acts as a central repository for master client records that are linked to accounts in trading and settlement systems, eliminating the operational overhead of needing multiple teams manage this information across multiple systems, ensuring consistency of this information across all consuming areas, and enabling the aggregation of client activity across different lines of business.

The Corporate Actions Analyst is responsible for the proactive identification and investigation of material changes (ex. mergers, acquisitions, dissolutions, etc.) to entities of interest, and the coordination of the necessary reference data changes in CDR and the facilitation of associated tasks across Account Management, KYC, and various stakeholder teams.
 

What will you do?

  • Review several sources (including external feeds or internal notifications) to identify corporate action events affecting entities of interest

  • Investigate and vet the details of corporate action events, and work with implicated teams to determine the necessary reference data updates

  • Notify stakeholder teams of corporate action events, and facilitate tasks across various implicated teams, for example KYC and Account Management

  • Produce metrics and report on the overall status of corporate actions processing

  • Perform UAT and PIV testing during CDR release cycles

What you need to succeed?

  • Post-secondary education or equivalent experience

  • 1 - 2 years of prior relevant experience preferably in a financial institution

  • Experience with corporate action event types and processing

  • Relationship Management – proactively building effective relationships with key stakeholders

  • Investigation and research experience – able to translate real-world entities and relationships into a data model

  • Excellent communication skills – written and oral

  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills

  • SQL queries to perform lookups and to filter data based on criteria

  • Analyze large data sets using pivot tables and pivot reporting

  • Comparing different sources of data using SQL Joins or in Excel

  • Awareness of trading and settlement processes

  • Extracting data to present metrics and reports

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

item.title: Director, Acquisition, TIS
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Acquisition, TIS

Job Description

What is the opportunity?​

We are looking for an eager and high performing individual to take on the role of Director, Acquisition, Term Investments & Savings (TIS). In this role, you will work closely with the TIS Team and engage numerous Functional Partners across Retail Enablement, Technology, Operations and Marketing. This is a key leadership role in shaping the direction of product and client acquisition across the product suite.

What will you do?

  • Management and maintenance of TIS campaigns, inclusive of strategy, design, development, execution of campaign strategies, resolving client and Advisor concerns & escalations, and reporting
  • Definition, management, and delivery of TIS campaign strategy and roadmap, in collaboration with the TIS product and pricing team
  • Monitoring, analyzing, and forecasting TIS growth performance
  • Collaborating with Retail Enablement, Operations, Technology, and other Functional Partners to support the TIS Team
  • Identifying new acquisition opportunities from emerging trends, market scans, and analysis
  • Representing TIS as a subject matter expert on campaigns and client growth
  • Ad-hoc projects and requests
  • Provide subject matter expertise on the acquisition of TIS products & clients, and operationalization of campaigns

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Leading development of small products and/or enhancements, and/or campaigns to acquire/engage/retain clients
  • Ability to operationalize ideas into execution, working collaboratively with teams across the organization
  • Understanding of distribution channels, strategies, and methods
  • Experience creating presentation materials for senior audiences
  • Experience with financial forecasting and interpreting trending analysis
  • Project management skills & experience

Nice to have:

  • Demonstrated track record of thought leadership, problem solving, and strong business communications
  • Ability to interact effectively with team members and senior business stakeholders
  • Strong Business Analysis and Financial Acumen
  • Advanced proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint (inc. strong storyboarding of executive presentations)
  • A passion for learning
  • Comfort with ambiguity

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Manager, Reporting, Automation & Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting, Automation & Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is currently recruiting for the exciting role of Manager, Reporting & Analytics. In this role, you will work directly with product / client partners in Client Profile Segment Team, especially the Newcomer & Cultural Client teams, to fulfill the following critical roles:

  • Support information-based business decisions by identifying, understanding, capturing, organizing, presenting, and disseminating data trends.
  • Work with business partners to grow profitable relationships with our clients and create sustainable value for RBC shareholders.

What will you do?

  • Participate in strategy meetings to provide input, gather and document business requirements, and help formulate analytical framework.
  • Influence the approach to answering business questions with deep RBC product insights.
  • Seek out new ways to engineer and manufacture best-in-class standard reports to showcase insights and support tactics.
  • Increase the standardization and efficiency of regular reporting.
  • Manage day-to-day workflow and negotiate realistic timelines.
  • Participate actively in self and peer development relating to financial products, operational processes, relationship management, and technology enhancement.
  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to.

Must-have:

  • 3 years of hands on experience with large relational databases and working experience with multiple querying tools such as native SQL, SAS, BI/Query
  • Proven technical experience with Tableau (desktop and server), UNIX and Windows integrated environments.
  • Be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environments.
  • Strong, innate, business and data acumen.
  • Applied data validation mechanisms.
  • Ability to thrive when working under pressure
  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or other quantitative discipline.

Nice-to-have:

  • Knowledge of Teradata or DB2 is definite asset.
  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment.
  • Experience with developing reports using OLAP tools.
  • Experience with financial products and services and their corresponding data.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Opportunity to learn and apply new businesses, techniques, and ideas.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

item.title: Sr. Manager, Risk Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Risk Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Global Asset Management (GAM) is the asset management division of the Royal Bank of Canada.  The RBC GAM group of companies manages more than CAD 550 billion in assets under management with investment teams located across Canada, the U.S., Europe and Asia. 

The RBC GAM Risk Management team provides independent oversight of RBC GAM’s investment activities across public and private markets.  The risk team is responsible for risk measurement and monitoring, risk policy and governance, providing effective challenge to investment teams, and helping to establish risk appetite.  Our stakeholders include RBC GAM clients, investment teams, regulators, and RBC GAM leaders. 

The successful candidate will be a key contributor to the RBC GAM Risk Management team with responsibilities described in the following sections. For further information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/

What will you do?

  • Research, design, and develop quantitative risk models and analysis tools

  • Conduct quantitative risk analysis on diverse investment portfolios

  • Develop and support production risk systems, including data infrastructure, analytics, reporting applications

  • Design risk metrics and set appropriate risk budgets and limits

  • Monitor and communicate risks to investment teams and executives

  • Perform root cause analysis and portfolio diagnostics

  • Quantitatively and qualitatively assess proposed new products

  • Conduct firm-level analysis including scenario analysis and stress testing

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Degree in engineering, physics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field

  • Strong interest in finance including equities, fixed income, derivatives, and risk analysis

  • Quantitative and technical skills, including experience with regression modelling, factor analysis, MATLAB / R / Python, C / C++ / C# / Java, SQL, Tableau / Power BI or similar tools.

  • Strong programming and code-debugging experience

  • Strong interest in data analysis, reporting, and data visualization

  • Attention to detail and strong written and verbal communication skills.

Nice To Have

  • Advanced degree (ideally PhD) in a quantitative field.

  • Experience or knowledge in finance and risk management including quantitative analysis and risk analytics.

  • Working experience with relational databases such as SQL Server and/or Oracle, including database development experience using T-SQL or Python ETL tools / libraries.

  • Knowledge of the asset management industry.

  • CFA, FRM or similar.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

item.title: Associate/VP - Quants
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate/VP - Quants

Job Description

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

As a front office quantitative analyst supporting the Commodities business, the candidate will be responsible for the provision of quantitative tools, analysis, and general analytical support to the trading desk. The RBC Quant team is responsible in developing & supporting next generation trading strategies and is the cornerstone of our Macro Quantitative Investment Strategies (Macro-QIS) business.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Development and implementation of tools to support trading desk, quantitative strategies infrastructure and risk management activities.
  • Gather new requirements from the trading desk and manage delivery of solutions through quant libraries and associated IT systems.
  • Maintenance and improvement of existing pricing tools and operational framework.
  • Provide general day-to-day quantitative support to trading desk.
  • Carry out special projects related to pricing models, trades, and risk management.
  • Assistance with the pricing of new products and feasibility of modelling approaches.
  • Provide desk-based research assistance as required.
  • Co-ordination with risk and functional teams as part of the process of submitting front office developed models for vetting and use in the bank\'s risk framework.
  • Help to recruit, retain and develop top talent.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have:

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline.
  • Advanced qualifications in mathematical finance and computing.
  • Strong written and oral communication.
  • At least 2 years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Programing: Python, C++, SQL.
  • Knowledge of derivative products and associated valuation methodologies.

Nice-to-have: 

  • Knowledge of Commodities, FX, and Rates derivatives.
  • Knowledge of Macro quantitative strategies and back-testing

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • A world-class training program in financial services.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.

ROAR - 559979033

#TECHPJ

item.title: Senior Risk Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Risk Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The C&C Senior Risk Analyst will be part of RBC Clearing & Custody, a fast-growing business channel.  This role will interact with C&C firms, along with internal personnel, on key financial risk items related to the C&C business.  This role will work closely with C&C Risk Manager, as well as with Senior C&C Management.

What will you do?

  • Review daily risk reports, identify issues of concern, and resolve and/or escalate accordingly
  • Review financial statements and Focus reports for existing firms and identify trends, variances, etc.
  • Utilize applicable monitoring tools for the review of proprietary trading by C&C client firms
  • Monitor C&C Market Access Rule (MAR) and ACT trading limits proactively escalating limit breach concerns to interested parties as appropriate
  • Work closely with C&C firms, along with internal C&C staff, on understanding new and/or proposed C&C firm activities and associated risks
  • Document new firm risk profiles, including firm snapshot and anticipated trading activities, which are used to incorporate risk limits for C&C Risk review process
  • Function as a liaison during new firm conversion process for new C&C firms with respects to risk limits and risk set-up process
  • Escalate risk concerns and limit increases appropriately, as defined within the delegation of authority matrix
  • Other project work, analysis assignments and duties as assigned

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Risk Management experience in a Broker-Dealer or Financial Services firm
  • Ability to work and communicate with all levels of management, as well as with C&C firms
  • Ability to work independently and under pressure, all while adhering to deadlines and tight schedules
  • Ability to influence others and convey difficult messages in a clear and concise manner
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • Series 7 and/or other advance licenses
  • Risk Management / Credit / Operations Background
  • Ability to adapt to an ever changing, fast paced environment

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business

Job Summary

•The Risk Analyst is responsible for reviewing, monitoring, and reporting financial risk associated with the Clearing & Custody business channel.
•This position will work closely with Risk Management personnel to analyze, understand, quantify and minimize financial risk to the business.

Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States of America

item.title: Real Estate Finance Risk Controls Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Real Estate Finance Risk Controls Analyst

Job Description

  • Assists in developing technology-based tools and performs data analysis to monitor, measure, and manage market and derivatives risks.
  • Assists in developing action plans to resolve issues. Re-designs processes to better manage, measure, and monitor market and derivatives risks.
  • Implements routine research and evaluation of the investments organization, business activities, and market and derivatives risk; assists in monitoring risk management policies, procedures, limits, and guidelines.
  • Participates in monitoring market risk to ensure that they are within market and derivatives risk thresholds, limits, and constraints. Explains market and derivatives policies and processes to other departments.

Job Summary

Implements market risk analysis and participates in implementing risk management systems and processes to minimize market risk. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.
